message.content:
{"id": "102436", "title": "Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design", "description": "An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.", "OB": "(1) The date/time value is not being correctly validated upon entry.", "EB": "(2) The date value should be validated by the UI or Model to ensure it conforms to a valid format.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter.
3. In the 'default value' field, type in an invalid date string, e.g. '55/66/9999'."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '102436', 'title': 'Bug 102436Date/time value not stored correctly in report design', 'description': 'Bug 102436Date/time value not stored correctly in report design An invaliddate/time string (which does not conform to a univeral format or the systemdefault locale format) should have been rejected. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '(2) The date value should have been validated by UI or Model. ', 'SR': 'New a "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer, in the "defaultvalue" field, type in some invalid date string, say "55/66/9999". '}
